              WORK CONTEXT
              
              The World Mosquito Program (WMP) is a not-for-profit initiative that works to protect the global community from mosquito-borne diseases such as dengue, Zika and chikungunya. Known until recently as the Eliminate Dengue Program, the WMP uses naturally occurring bacteria called Wolbachia to reduce the ability of mosquitoes to transmit these viruses. Accumulating evidence is supportive of very large impact on disease transmission and large clinical trials and demonstration projects are currently underway.
              
              Following many years of laboratory research and field trials with promising results, the WMP has expanded to 12 countries worldwide and has widespread support from communities, governments and regulators. The World Mosquito Program has two regional hubs – our Asia hub in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, and Oceania hub, based at Monash University in Melbourne, Australia. As well as supporting projects in Vietnam, Sri Lanka, India and Indonesia, our Asia hub contributes to core global operations.
              
              The World Mosquito Program is working in partnership with Action on Poverty to protect communities in Vietnam from mosquito-borne diseases.
              

              JOB PURPOSE SUMMARY
              
              The Digital Design officer provides design and branding expertise to provide a range of digital design services to communicate the World Mosquito Program (WMP) through presentations, digital assets and marketing materials.  The position also manages digital communications including the graphic design assets for the website and social media, working closely with international project sites to apply the WMP brand globally.
              

              AUTHORITY
              
              Reporting Line: The position reports to the Marketing and Communications Adviser under broad direction, working with a degree of autonomy.
              

              KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
              
              1.	Maintain and enhance a brand style guide with templates for use in print and electronic publishing across all project sites.
              
              2.	Advise and implement regular design requests across various project sites, such as newsletters print and electronic, brochures, fact sheets, PowerPoint presentations, posters etc. using InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop and Word and following the Program style guide.
              
              3.	Provide design support for the rollout of a new WMP website and country project websites.
              
              4.	Provide high level support and website management system training for the program and project sites.
              
              5.	Regularly update and monitor website content to ensure web pages are maintained in a timely fashion and in accordance with WMP standards.
              
              6.	Create upload and, when necessary, manipulate images using design software, and manage their storage and retrieval to facilitate sharing of images across project sites that reflect the WMP brand.
              
              7.	Provide support for the production of the WMP communications, brand and new project set up documents.
              
              8.	Guide and monitor the Program and Project sites’ digital presence.
              
              9.	Manage the Program’s stakeholder databases.
              
              10.	Proof-read all print and electronic communications and ensure compliance with WMP standards.

Yêu Cầu Công Việc
             

              ESSENTIAL
              
              1.	A relevant qualification and/or equivalent experience in Graphic Design/and or Web design and Communications
              
              2.	Demonstrated creative capability and enthusiasm to innovate and recommend new approaches
              
              3.	Demonstrated experience in communicating technical information effectively to a variety of audiences
              
              4.	Advanced computer skills, including experience in Adobe InDesign suite, Microsoft Office and web-based content management systems
              
              5.	A sound understanding of production processes for print and electronic publications, including social media
              
              6.	Aptitude for and experience in digital photography, audio and video recording, editing and publishing
              
              7.	Excellent interpersonal skills with a proven ability to interact with a variety of stakeholders
              
              8.	Demonstrable high level of attention to detail
              
              9.	Proven organisational skills including the ability to work with limited supervision, meet deadlines and initiate, prioritise, organise and complete complex work tasks as required
              
              DESIRABLE
              
              10.	Copywriting and editing skills
              
              11.	An interest in, and desire to contribute to, the vision and values of a not for profit scientific research program
